question: Question_03_(c)
statement:
\textbf{Decide whether the following statement is true or false. You
need not give a reason. All matrices in this question are square
$n \times n$.}

Eigenvalues of an anti-symmetric matrix (i.e.,
\emph{A\textsuperscript{T} = âA}) are negative.
sols:
This statement is \textbf{false}.

For a counter example, let

\[A = \begin{bmatrix}
0 & -1\\ 
1 & 0
\end{bmatrix}\]

Then \emph{A} is anti-symmetric. However, the characteristic polynomial
of \emph{A} is \emph{x\textsuperscript{2}+1}. Hence \emph{A} has the
eigenvalues \emph{λ = i} and \emph{λ = -i}, which are not real numbers
and hence neither positive nor negative.
